summary: Chile  is a country on the south-western side of South America.
full_text:
Robert F. Jones  was a novelist and an outdoor writer for Sports Illustrated and Field & Stream. Many of his novels contain fantastic and/or surrealistic elements, causing some critics to label his work slipstream. Jones' archive resides at the Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library at the University of Virginia.
He died December 18, 2002, of natural causes in Bennington, VT at age 68.
title: Blood Sport (novel)
